Should Politicians private lives be under consideration by the public?
of course not, that is invasion of privacy. we already know they are all corrupt anyway. :)

Politicians private lives should only be under scrutiny if it could affect their service to the people who elect them.
 
 Example: A candidate smoked pot. If he tried it 20 years ago, who cares. If he's still doing it today, I don't want him representing me.

When you were asking this question, was it somewhat in reference to Bill Clinton? Personally, I think that whole thing was blown out of proportion. Is that the type of thing that you're saying should be investigated?

No, it wasn't in reference to Bill Clinton. It was towards all policitians, past, present and future. Presidents, Congress, Senate, Governers, Mayors, or a simple Representative??
 I'm not saying we should judge them by their mistakes, but we should take them into consideration...
 For example, if a man or a woman candidate, was in the military, and buckled under pressure, do you really want them making decisions that would affect you, your family, friends, children and neighbors?? 
 If they were audited by the IRS, or if they served jail time for embezzlement, would you want them in control of your state's budget? 
 If they are dishonest at home, and lie to the people they are supposed to love the most, are they honest with us??
 
 Not just Bill Clinton, everybody.

who says they will abuse the system? everyone has something to hide; if you were to pick put every little 'bad' thing, there would be no politicians in office.
 
 no one is perfect.

Be careful of what you say. My parents were audited by the IRS, but did nothing wrong. Also, I don't think a person's personal life should be under scrutiny unless they used their office for gain in that area. Everyone probably has something they've done that they don't want everyone to know about.

Yes, we all have skeletons in our closets, ones that we hope nobody ever finds out about. But that is something we have to think about every time we make a decision, 'is this gonna come back and bite me in the butt?' 
 Besides, if someone does something wrong and doesn't want anyone to find out about it, then they shouldn't have done it.
 I know there are things that I have done, and I hate it when someone brings it up, or if it 'comes up' ya know, but it makes me think about my decisions. And it makes me think about the consequences before I make other decisions. 
 
 All we can do is learn from our mistakes, (smoking pot 20 years ago, etc.) but if we continue to make those mistakes ( smoking pot on a regular basis, for example) then we didn't really learn from the mistakes, right?
 
 I understand that politicians are under alot of pressure and have to make decisions on certain deadlines, but if they think about the consequences, the right decision should be made.

And another thing, our politicans (mayors, governers, presidents) are also role models for the future generation. These children look up to these guys. Do you want your kids role model to be someone that cheats on their wife, or steals taxpayers money, or goes out and gets drunk every night, or uses drugs?? 
 I know that I don't. Because what kids see in a role model, is what they want to be like. So if we show our kids that our role models do this, we are also telling our kids that it is okay to cheat, steal, drink and do drugs??
 What message do you want to send to the kids??
